titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. A. Lewis and Rebecca L. Smith family papers (series 61) 1856-1969 1870s-1913
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. A. Lewis and Rebecca L. Smith family papers (series 61)

bioghist.p: A. Lewis Smith (1831-1914) and Rebecca Levis Wood (1837-1925) married in 1859 and settled in Media, Delaware County, Pennsylvania. They raised a family of four children: Henry Clement (1860-1936), Rebecca (1862-1947), Lewis Lawrence (1864-1931), and Helen Bright (1875-1958). The Brinton, Easby, Cheyney, and Clemson families are related to the Smiths through the marriages of the children of A. Lewis and Rebecca. The oldest son, Henry Clement, married Anna Potts Cheyney (1868-1961) in 1889. Lewis Lawrence, the youngest son, married Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson (1867-1947) in 1892. Rebecca married William Easby, Jr. (1862-1957) in 1892. The youngest child, Helen Bright, married Joseph Hill Brinton (1868-1920) in 1902.

scopecontent.p: The papers include greeting cards and hotel menu cards; letters from family friends Mary Jacques and Felix Schilling; postcards; calling cards; correspondence related to the wedding of Helen Bright Smith; and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
